gdverse

The goal of gdverse is to support the geodetector model and its variants.

Installation

You can install the development version of gdverse from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("SpatLyu/gdverse",build_vignettes = T,dep = T)

or install gdverse from r-universe:

install.packages('gdverse', repos='https://spatlyu.r-universe.dev')

Load data and package 

library(sf)
library(terra)
library(tidyverse)
library(gdverse)
fvcpath = "https://github.com/SpatLyu/rdevdata/raw/main/FVC.tif"
fvc = terra::rast(paste0("/vsicurl/",fvcpath))
fvc = terra::aggregate(fvc,fact = 5)
fvc = as_tibble(terra::as.data.frame(fvc,na.rm = T))
head(fvc)
## # A tibble: 6 × 13
##     fvc premax premin presum tmpmax tmpmin tmpavg   pop   ntl  lulc  elev slope
##   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>

OPGD model 

tictoc::tic()
fvc_opgd = opgd(fvc ~ ., data = fvc, discnum = 3:15,
                discvar = names(select(fvc,-c(fvc,lulc))),
                cores = 6, type = 'factor')
tictoc::toc()
## 2.92 sec elapsed
fvc_opgd

RGD model

To run RGD,remember to set up your python dependence, see RGD vignette to get more details.

reticulate::use_condaenv('geocompy')
tictoc::tic()
fvc_rgd = rgd(fvc ~ ., data = fvc, discnum = 15, 
              discvar = names(select(fvc,-c(fvc,lulc))),
              cores = 8, type = 'factor')
tictoc::toc()
## 2980.2 sec elapsed
fvc_rgd
## Spatial Stratified Heterogeneity Test 
##  
##           Factor detector
